title: Uffington Cricket Club: judges’ comments
text: Read more about the Great Cricket Tea Challenge Telegraph Weekend cookery and food writer Xanthe Clay and Telegraph Sport writer Gareth A Davies reveal why Uffington deserved a berth in the Yorkshire Tea Great Cricket Tea Challenge final. Xanthe Clay The spread was lavish: utterly amazing cakes; really good sandwiches, filled and cut to perfection; bread from the local bakery; beef from the local butcher, cooked to rosy perfection; wonderful honey-cooked ham. The hummingbird cake really was award-winning – very moist with heaps of flavour, slightly nubbly, with nuts and tiny pieces of pineapple. With that icing it is delicious, sugar heaven. Gareth A Davies It was delicious. I had a plate of savoury food – pork pie, haslet – which I loved, and then I went back for the beautifully cut sandwiches, followed by an array of cakes that were all just baked and prepared to perfection. The co-ordination of a large team and massive spread was so impressive. I took a seat on the boundary behind the bowler’s arm with two plates of food, and it was heavenly. Vaughan's verdict: the hummingbird cake Each finalist bakes a cake for former England captain Michael Vaughan to taste and judge. This American cake has banana, pineapple, orange zest – and a very rich icing. Vaughan said: "A cute cake, very tasty. We ate it at home and my son took the rest to school, where it was devoured."
